mdRecord.dcterms:title: Visitors at the Tomb, June 1859
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Walker, Lewis E. (Emory) - possible
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Albumen print mounted to cardboard. View of the southwest corner of the tomb. Nine people stand and pose near the tomb entrance most notably is an unidentified man holding a hat and handkerchief and an African-American man holding onto the iron railing near one of the obelisks. The remaining visitors, which mostly appear to be African-American, include four women, two men and a child. Part of a series of three photographs taken the same day - see also 2019-VR-017.001 and 2019-VR-017.002
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Washington, George, 1732-1799--Tomb
